definitions: person belonging to ancient civilizations of Mexico and Central America before European contact
inhabitant or descendant of cultures from the geographical area between central Mexico and northern Costa Rica
examples: The Mesoamerican developed sophisticated calendar systems long before European arrival
Ancient Mesoamericans built impressive pyramids throughout their territories
Modern Mesoamericans preserve many traditional customs from their ancestors
The museum exhibit features artwork created by contemporary Mesoamerican artists

definitions: middle period of the Stone Age between Paleolithic and Neolithic eras characterized by small stone tools
examples: The Mesolithic lasted from about 10,000 to 5,000 years ago
During the Mesolithic, humans began developing more advanced hunting techniques

definitions: geological era from 252 to 66 million years ago known as the age of reptiles and dinosaurs
examples: The Mesozoic witnessed the rise and fall of the dinosaurs
Many fossils from the Mesozoic are found in sedimentary rock layers

definitions: promised deliverer of Jewish people prophesied in Hebrew scripture to restore Israel and bring peace
person regarded as a liberator or savior of a group, cause, or movement
examples: Many Jews still await the coming of the Messiah prophesied in scripture
Christians believe Jesus was the Messiah promised in the Old Testament
The fans treated the new coach like a messiah who would save the team
Some viewed the political candidate as a messiah for economic reform

definitions: Protestant Christian denomination founded by John Wesley emphasizing personal faith and social holiness
examples: Methodism spread rapidly throughout England and America in the 18th century
The principles of Methodism include both personal piety and social justice

definitions: member or adherent of the Methodist Church or its beliefs and practices
examples: The Methodist attended Sunday services at the local chapel every week
Many Methodists participate actively in community service and outreach programs

definitions: biblical figure who lived 969 years according to Genesis, the longest-lived person in the Bible
person of great age or something that has existed for an extremely long time
examples: Methuselah appears in the genealogy leading from Adam to Noah
According to scripture, Methuselah died in the year of the great flood
The ancient tree was a real Methuselah, estimated to be over 4,000 years old
My grandfather jokes that he feels like Methuselah when talking to teenagers

definitions: Spanish term for a Mexican person or someone of Mexican descent or nationality
examples: The Mexicano shared stories about his hometown near Guadalajara
Many Mexicanos celebrate their cultural heritage through traditional festivals

definitions: mebibyte, a unit of digital information storage equal to 1,048,576 bytes
examples: The file size is approximately 25 MiB when compressed
Modern applications often require hundreds of MiB of memory to run smoothly

definitions: region comprising countries of southwestern Asia and northeastern Africa around the eastern Mediterranean
examples: Oil production in the Mideast significantly influences global energy markets
The Mideast has been a crossroads of civilizations for thousands of years

definitions: Musical Instrument Digital Interface, a technical standard for electronic musical instruments and computers
southern region of France, particularly the area around the Mediterranean coast
examples: The composer saved the song as a MIDI file for easy editing
Musicians use MIDI controllers to create and manipulate digital sounds
They spent their vacation exploring the beautiful villages of the Midi
The Midi produces some of France's finest wines and olive oils

definitions: central or inland part of a country or region, especially the central counties of England
examples: The Midland counties of England have a rich industrial heritage
They moved from the coast to a small town in the midland region

definitions: ancient Jewish commentary on Hebrew scriptures containing interpretation, illustration, or expansion of biblical text
examples: The rabbi quoted from the Midrash to explain the deeper meaning of the passage
Students spent years studying both Torah and Midrash in the yeshiva

definitions: area at a fair or carnival with games, rides, and amusement attractions
point or place situated equally distant from extremes or exactly in the middle
examples: Children begged their parents for money to play games on the midway
The midway featured a giant Ferris wheel and dozens of food vendors
The rest stop was located midway between the two cities
We'll meet at the midway point of the hiking trail for lunch

definitions: middle of the week, typically Tuesday through Thursday, between the beginning and end
examples: Hotel rates are usually lower during midweek than on weekends
The committee schedules its regular meetings for midweek to maximize attendance

definitions: north-central region of the United States including states like Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, and Michigan
examples: The Midwest is often called America's heartland for its agricultural importance
Many people from the Midwest move to coastal cities for job opportunities

definitions: person from Milan, Italy, or relating to the city's culture, style, or characteristics
examples: The Milanese are known for their sophisticated fashion sense and style
Our tour guide was a proud Milanese who shared local history and traditions

definitions: person who owns or operates a mill for grinding grain into flour or meal
examples: The miller worked from dawn to dusk grinding wheat for the village
Local farmers brought their grain to the miller every harvest season

definitions: small-seeded cereal grain grown as food crop in dry regions of Asia and Africa
examples: Farmers planted millet because it tolerates drought better than wheat
The porridge was made from millet and sweetened with local honey

definitions: abbreviation for minute, a unit of time equal to sixty seconds
examples: The recipe says to bake for 30 min at 350 degrees
Please wait 5 min before taking your blood pressure again

definitions: Roman goddess of wisdom, strategic warfare, arts, trade, and medicine, equivalent to Greek Athena
examples: The ancient temple was dedicated to Minerva, protector of craftsmen
Minerva appears on many Roman coins holding a spear and shield

definitions: member or artifact of the Bronze Age civilization on Crete from 3000 to 1100 BCE
examples: The Minoan created elaborate frescoes depicting dolphins and bull-leaping ceremonies
Archaeologists discovered Minoan pottery fragments at the excavation site

definitions: creature from Greek mythology with the head of a bull and body of a man, imprisoned in the Cretan labyrinth
examples: According to legend, the Minotaur was slain by the hero Theseus
The Minotaur demanded tribute of seven youths and seven maidens each year

definitions: member of American colonial militia ready to fight at a minute's notice during the Revolutionary War
intercontinental ballistic missile system developed by the United States Air Force
examples: The Minuteman grabbed his musket when the alarm bells rang through the village
Minutemen played a crucial role in the battles of Lexington and Concord
The Minuteman missile system formed a key part of America's nuclear deterrent
Decommissioned Minuteman silos are now tourist attractions in some states

definitions: geological epoch from 23 to 5.3 million years ago marked by grassland expansion and mammal diversification
examples: During the Miocene, early apes evolved and spread across Africa and Eurasia
Fossil evidence from the Miocene shows the emergence of many modern animal families

definitions: first major written collection of Jewish oral traditions and laws compiled around 200 CE
examples: Rabbinical students memorize large portions of the Mishnah during their studies
The Mishnah forms the foundation of the Talmud's legal discussions

definitions: geological period from 359 to 323 million years ago, part of the Carboniferous period
pre-Columbian Native American culture flourishing in southeastern United States from 800 to 1600 CE
examples: Mississippian limestone formations contain many marine fossils from ancient seas
During the Mississippian, much of North America was covered by shallow seas
The Mississippian built large earthen mounds that still exist today
Mississippian societies developed complex agricultural and trading networks

definitions: title of respect or courtesy used before a man's surname or full name
examples: Please tell Mister Johnson that his appointment has been rescheduled
The children always called their neighbor Mister Smith out of respect

definitions: wealthy and powerful person, especially in business or entertainment industry
rounded bump of hard snow on a ski slope formed by repeated turns
examples: The media mogul owned newspapers and television stations across the country
Several Hollywood moguls attended the exclusive charity gala last night
Expert skiers navigated the moguls with grace and precision
She fell while attempting to ski through the challenging mogul field

definitions: member of an Iroquois people originally from the Mohawk River valley in New York
hairstyle with shaved sides and a strip of hair down the center of the head
examples: The Mohawk were known as keepers of the eastern door of the Iroquois Confederacy
Many Mohawk still live on reservations in New York and Canada
The punk rocker styled his bright green mohawk with strong gel
She decided to get a mohawk for the summer music festival

definitions: member of a Central Asian people who created a vast empire under Genghis Khan in the 13th century
examples: The Mongol conquered much of Asia and Eastern Europe in the 1200s
Modern Mongols maintain many traditional customs including nomadic herding

definitions: person from Mongolia or of Mongolian descent, or relating to Mongolia's culture and language
examples: The Mongolian demonstrated traditional throat singing at the cultural festival
Our Mongolian guide explained the significance of the ancient stone monuments

definitions: man who has taken religious vows and lives in a monastery devoted to prayer and contemplation
examples: The monk spent hours each day in silent meditation and prayer
Buddhist monks walked through the village collecting alms in their bowls

definitions: exclusive control of a commodity or service in a market, or a company having such control
popular board game where players buy and develop properties to bankrupt opponents
examples: The company held a monopoly on telephone service until deregulation occurred
Government regulators work to prevent monopolies that harm consumer choice
The family played Monopoly every Sunday afternoon for hours
She always chose the thimble token when playing Monopoly with friends

definitions: French title of respect or courtesy for a man, equivalent to Mister in English
examples: The waiter addressed him as Monsieur throughout the elegant dinner service
Monsieur Dupont teaches French literature at the local university

definitions: honorary title for certain Roman Catholic priests ranking below bishop but above regular priests
examples: Monsignor O'Brien celebrated his 50th anniversary of ordination last month
The Pope appointed him Monsignor in recognition of his years of service

definitions: tract of open uncultivated upland typically covered with heather and bracken
member of Muslim people of mixed Arab and Berber descent from North Africa
examples: Hikers got lost in the fog while crossing the desolate moor
The Yorkshire moors are famous for their wild beauty and purple heather
The Moor ruled much of Spain during the medieval period
Moorish architecture left a lasting influence on Spanish building design

definitions: relating to the Moors or their art, architecture, and culture, especially in medieval Spain
examples: The palace featured beautiful Moorish arches and intricate tile work
Moorish influence is evident in the geometric patterns decorating the walls

definitions: member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints founded by Joseph Smith in 1830
examples: The Mormon missionary spent two years serving in South America
Many Mormons participate in genealogical research to trace their family history

definitions: religious tradition and practices of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
examples: Mormonism emphasizes strong family values and community service
The history of Mormonism includes a westward migration to Utah

definitions: person from Morocco or of Moroccan descent, or relating to Morocco's culture
examples: The Moroccan served traditional mint tea to welcome the guests
Moroccan cuisine combines Arab, Berber, and Mediterranean influences

definitions: informal offensive term for a person considered extremely foolish or lacking intelligence
examples: He felt bad after calling his brother a moron during their argument
The driver who cut her off in traffic was acting like a complete moron

definitions: system of dots and dashes representing letters and numbers for telegraph communication, invented by Samuel Morse
examples: Ships used Morse code to send distress signals before modern radio
Amateur radio operators still learn Morse for emergency communications

definitions: picture or pattern produced by arranging small colored pieces of stone, tile, or glass
combination of diverse elements forming a coherent pattern or picture
examples: The ancient Roman mosaic depicted scenes from mythology in tiny tiles
Artists spent months creating the mosaic for the cathedral floor
The city's neighborhoods form a cultural mosaic of different ethnic communities
Her life experiences created a mosaic of memories and wisdom
